result.execSummary:
The defendant Alejandre R Hopkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 254 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent INCLUDING Sex Offender Treatment.
No contact with B.S.J.
No unsupervised contact with any minor under the age of 18 without prior Agent approval.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison

Defendant Alejandre R Hopkins in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Count #1:
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

3 YEARS 8 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 254 days) Sentence to begin forthwith. 
  -  1 YEAR 2 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS 6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; including sex offender treatment;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  B.S.J.
*No unsupervised contact with any minor under the age of 18 without prior approval of agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Comply with sex offender registry for 15 years.
*Any other term deemed appropriate by agent.

COURT COSTS:  $125.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by Atty Menden.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Alejandre R Hopkins in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden advises the Court she has received the records and is waiting for the doctor to complete her report.  The Court sets the matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Alejandre R Hopkins in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith advises the Court that the parties have reached a resolution.  The State files a 2nd amended information.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Attorney Smith requests that bail not be revoked.  The State requests the Court revoke bail  The Court revokes bail and sets the matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
